IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PARTHENIA STREET SENIOR CITIZEN HOUSING CORPORATION, A CALIFORNIA NONPROFIT CORPORATION, WAS FORMED TO OWN A 77-UNIT RENTAL HOUSING PROJECT FOR THE very low income ELDERLY LOCATED IN LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA. THE OPERATIONS OF THE PROJECT BEGAN DECEMBER 2007. THE CORPORATION IS OPERATED UNDER SECTION 202 OF THE NATIONAL HOUSING ACT. THE CORPORATION HAS EXECUTED A REGULATORY AGREEMENT WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT, WHICH GOVERNS THE OPERATION OF THE PROJECT WITH RESPECT TO RENTAL CHARGES AND OPERATING METHODS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Parthenia Street Senior Citizen Housing Corporation, a California Nonprofit Corporation, was formed to own a 77-unit rental housing project for the very low income elderly located in Los Angeles, California. The operations of the Project began December 2007. The Corporation is operated under Section 202 of the National Housing Act. The Corporation has executed a regulatory agreement with the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development, which governs the operation of the Project with respect to rental charges and operating methods.
IRS990.Description: Parthenia Street Senior Citizen Housing Corporation, a California Nonprofit Corporation, was formed to own a 77-unit rental housing project for the very low income elderly located in Los Angeles, California. The operations of the Project began December 2007. The Corporation is operated under Section 202 of the National Housing Act. The Corporation has executed a regulatory agreement with the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development, which governs the operation of the Project with respect to rental charges and operating methods.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part IV, Supplemental Information: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10: Miscellaneous income consists of tenant charges, laundry and vending charges and other income items for services provided for the convenience of the tenants.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: In 2009, the corporation adopted the Income Taxes topic of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 740, which provides guidance for how uncertain income tax positions should be recognized, measured, presented and disclosed in the financial statements. The corporation is required to evaluate the income tax positions taken or expected to be taken to determine whether the positions are "more-likely-than-not" to be substained upon examination by the applicable tax authority. The corporation has determined that the application of the Income Taxes standard does not impact the operations of the Corporation and that no provision for income tax is required in the Corporation's financial statements. There has been no interest or penalties recognized in the income statement or balance sheet for the year ended August 31, 2010. As of August 31, 2010, the following federal and State tax years remain open - United States: years ended August 31, 2007 through 2010, and state of california: years ended August 31, 2006 through 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 3
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Parthenia street senior Housing Corporation is managed by Menorah Housing Foundation. Menorah Housing Foundation is a non-profit professional property management company specializing in housing for the very low income elderly. Menorah Housing Foundation has a project owner's and management agent's certification for multifamily housing projects with the US department of Housing and Urban Development. Under this certification, HUD has approved Menorah Housing Foundation to manage the project under Parthenia Street Senior Housing Corporation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE AUDITING FIRM SENDS A DRAFT OF THE RETURN TO THE MANAGEMENT COMPANY. THE MANAGEMENT COMPANY FORWARDS A COPY OF THE RETURN TO EACH BOARD MEMBER FOR THEIR COMMENTS PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board members sign off on the policy annually and abstain from any voting where a conflict could exist.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The process includes all of these elements: (1) review and approval by the Board of Directors or compensation committee of the Organization; (2) use of data as to comparable compensation; and (3) contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping. 1. Review and Approval. The compensation of the person is reviewed and approved by the Board of Directors or compensation committee of the Organization, provided that persons with conflicts of interest with respect to the compensation arrangement at issue are not involved in this review and approval. 2. Use of data as to comparable compensation. The compensation of the person is reviewed and approved using data as to comparable compensation for similarly qualified persons in functionally comparable positions at similarly situated organizations. 3. Contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping. There is contemporaneous documentation and recordkeeping with respect to the deliberations and decisions regarding the compensation arrangement.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The form 990 and all related financial and policy information are made available to the public upon written request.

the management company receives a copy of the audit. prior to the finalization of the audit, a copy of the audit is given to all of the board members for their comments. when the audit is up for bid, the board discusses the relationship with the current auditors and makes a determination as to whether to maintain this relationship or change to a new auditing firm.

MENORAH HOUSING FOUNDATION IS THE MANAGEMENT COMPANY AND EMPLOYS THE INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK AT THE PROJECT. PARTHENIA STREET SENIOR CITIZEN HOUSING CORP REIMBURSES THE FOUNDATION FOR THE EMPLOYEE'S SALARIES AND OTHER COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THEIR EMPLOYMENT.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: complete listing of board members and key employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: due to limitation of the number of lines on schedule L, part iv, not all of the board members and key employees are being shown on page one of schedule L.
